name: Introduction to Cultural Studies
description: This course introduces students to the field of Cultural Studies, covering topics such as how culture is produced, consumed, and experienced. Students will also learn about cultural practices and their effects on social structures.

name: Introduction to Performance Studies
description: This course introduces students to the field of Performance Studies, covering topics such as the history of performance art, techniques for analyzing performance, and the role of performance in constructing social identities. Students will also explore the ways in which performance can be used to disrupt conventional ways of thinking.

name: Theory and Practice of Performance
description: This course examines the theory and practice of performance from a variety of perspectives, focusing on questions of audience, context, and the role of the performer. Students will also explore the ways in which performance can be used to challenge existing power structures and to create alternative models of understanding.

name: Performance and Social Change
description: This course examines the role of performance in social and political change. Students will explore the ways in which performance can be used to challenge existing power structures and to create alternative models of understanding. Through case studies and practical exercises, students will develop an understanding of how performance can be used to affect social change.
